trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes the different operations that can be performed on your StorSimple device controllers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes the different operations that can be performed on your StorSimple device controllers.

trans-unit.source: The controllers in your StorSimple device are redundant (peer) controllers in an active-passive configuration.
trans-unit.target: The controllers in your StorSimple device are redundant (peer) controllers in an active-passive configuration.

trans-unit.source: At a given time, only one controller is active, and is processing all the disk and network operations.
trans-unit.target: At a given time, only one controller is active, and is processing all the disk and network operations.

trans-unit.source: The other controller is in a passive mode.
trans-unit.target: The other controller is in a passive mode.

trans-unit.source: If the active controller fails, the passive controller becomes active automatically.
trans-unit.target: If the active controller fails, the passive controller becomes active automatically.

trans-unit.source: Restart or shut down a single controller
trans-unit.target: Restart or shut down a single controller

trans-unit.source: A controller restart or shut down is not required as a part of normal system operation.
trans-unit.target: A controller restart or shut down is not required as a part of normal system operation.

trans-unit.source: Shutdown operations for a single device controller are common only in cases in which a failed device hardware component requires replacement.
trans-unit.target: Shutdown operations for a single device controller are common only in cases in which a failed device hardware component requires replacement.

trans-unit.source: A controller restart may also be required in a situation in which performance is affected by excessive memory usage or a malfunctioning controller.
trans-unit.target: A controller restart may also be required in a situation in which performance is affected by excessive memory usage or a malfunctioning controller.

trans-unit.source: You may also need to restart a controller after a successful controller replacement, if you wish to enable and test the replaced controller.
trans-unit.target: You may also need to restart a controller after a successful controller replacement, if you wish to enable and test the replaced controller.

trans-unit.source: Restarting a device is not disruptive to connected initiators, assuming the passive controller is available.
trans-unit.target: Restarting a device is not disruptive to connected initiators, assuming the passive controller is available.

trans-unit.source: If a passive controller is not available or turned off, then restarting the active controller may result in the disruption of service and downtime.
trans-unit.target: If a passive controller is not available or turned off, then restarting the active controller may result in the disruption of service and downtime.

trans-unit.source: A running controller should never be physically removed as this would result in a loss of redundancy and an increased risk of downtime.
trans-unit.target: A running controller should never be physically removed as this would result in a loss of redundancy and an increased risk of downtime.

trans-unit.source: Questions and answers about managing device controllers
trans-unit.target: Questions and answers about managing device controllers

trans-unit.source: In this section, we have summarized some of the frequently asked questions regarding managing StorSimple device controllers.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we have summarized some of the frequently asked questions regarding managing StorSimple device controllers.

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: What happens if both the controllers on my device are healthy and turned on and I restart or shut down the active controller?
trans-unit.target: What happens if both the controllers on my device are healthy and turned on and I restart or shut down the active controller?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: If both the controllers on your device are healthy and turned on, you will be prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If both the controllers on your device are healthy and turned on, you will be prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: You may choose to:
trans-unit.target: You may choose to:

trans-unit.source: **Restart the active controller** – You will be notified that restarting an active controller will cause the device to failover to the passive controller.
trans-unit.target: **Restart the active controller** – You will be notified that restarting an active controller will cause the device to failover to the passive controller.

trans-unit.source: The controller will restart.
trans-unit.target: The controller will restart.

trans-unit.source: **Shut down an active controller** – You will be notified that shutting down an active controller will result in downtime.
trans-unit.target: **Shut down an active controller** – You will be notified that shutting down an active controller will result in downtime.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to push the power button on the device to turn on the controller.
trans-unit.target: You will also need to push the power button on the device to turn on the controller.

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: What happens if the passive controller on my device is unavailable or turned off and I restart or shut down the active controller?
trans-unit.target: What happens if the passive controller on my device is unavailable or turned off and I restart or shut down the active controller?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: If the passive controller on your device is unavailable or turned off, and you choose to:
trans-unit.target: If the passive controller on your device is unavailable or turned off, and you choose to:

trans-unit.source: **Restart the active controller** – You will be notified that continuing the operation will result in a temporary disruption of the service, and you will be prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: **Restart the active controller** – You will be notified that continuing the operation will result in a temporary disruption of the service, and you will be prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: **Shut down an active controller** – You will be notified that continuing the operation will result in downtime, and that you will need to push the power button on one or both controllers to turn on the device.
trans-unit.target: **Shut down an active controller** – You will be notified that continuing the operation will result in downtime, and that you will need to push the power button on one or both controllers to turn on the device.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: When would the controller restart or shutdown fail to progress?
trans-unit.target: When would the controller restart or shutdown fail to progress?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: Restarting or shutting down a controller may fail if:
trans-unit.target: Restarting or shutting down a controller may fail if:

trans-unit.source: A device update is in progress.
trans-unit.target: A device update is in progress.

trans-unit.source: A controller restart is already in progress.
trans-unit.target: A controller restart is already in progress.

trans-unit.source: A controller shutdown is already in progress.
trans-unit.target: A controller shutdown is already in progress.

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: How can you figure out if a controller was restarted or shut down?
trans-unit.target: How can you figure out if a controller was restarted or shut down?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: You can check the controller status on the Maintenance page.
trans-unit.target: You can check the controller status on the Maintenance page.

trans-unit.source: The controller status will indicate whether a controller has been restarted or shut down.
trans-unit.target: The controller status will indicate whether a controller has been restarted or shut down.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the Alerts page will contain an informational alert if the controller was restarted or shut down.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the Alerts page will contain an informational alert if the controller was restarted or shut down.

trans-unit.source: The controller restart and shutdown operations are also recorded in the operation logs.
trans-unit.target: The controller restart and shutdown operations are also recorded in the operation logs.

trans-unit.source: For more information about operation logs, go to [View the operation logs](storsimple-service-dashboard.md#view-the-operations-logs).
trans-unit.target: For more information about operation logs, go to [View the operation logs](storsimple-service-dashboard.md#view-the-operations-logs).

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: Is there any impact to the I/Os as a result of controller failover?
trans-unit.target: Is there any impact to the I/Os as a result of controller failover?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: The TCP connections between initiators and active controller will be reset as a result of controller failover, but will be reestablished when the passive controller assumes operation.
trans-unit.target: The TCP connections between initiators and active controller will be reset as a result of controller failover, but will be reestablished when the passive controller assumes operation.

trans-unit.source: There may be a temporary (less than 30 second) pause in I/O activity between initiators and the device during the course of this operation.
trans-unit.target: There may be a temporary (less than 30 second) pause in I/O activity between initiators and the device during the course of this operation.

trans-unit.source: Q.
trans-unit.target: Q.

trans-unit.source: How do I return my controller to service after it has been shut down and removed?
trans-unit.target: How do I return my controller to service after it has been shut down and removed?

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: To return a controller to service, you must insert it into the chassis as described in [Replace a controller module on your StorSimple device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md).
trans-unit.target: To return a controller to service, you must insert it into the chassis as described in [Replace a controller module on your StorSimple device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md).
